Introduction Erik Wilde: Your APIs Are Not Ready for AI (Yet): A Lifecycle-Based Readiness Guide

(4) Setting the Stage

  • AI and specifically agents don't make much sense without APIs
  • API landscapes have been around for quite a while
  • Building a bridge between API Land and AI Land
  • Evolve existing landscapes and guidance with the bridge in mind

APIs for AI: Problem or Not? Erik Wilde: Your APIs Are Not Ready for AI (Yet): A Lifecycle-Based Readiness Guide

(6) How does AI affect APIs?



APIs for AI: Problem or Not? Erik Wilde: Your APIs Are Not Ready for AI (Yet): A Lifecycle-Based Readiness Guide

(7) From DX to AX

  • APIs were typically consumed by developers
  • Developers write code that often fills API/UX gaps
  • AI takes the developer out of the picture
  • LLMs have much more limited context than developers
  • AI consumption of APIs needs to mind the API/UX gap


Model Context Protocol (MCP)

Model Context Protocol (MCP) Erik Wilde: Your APIs Are Not Ready for AI (Yet): A Lifecycle-Based Readiness Guide

(9) Model Context Protocol (MCP)

  • MCP seems to be the new standard protocol for LLM consumers
  • Many mapping tools generate MCP from OpenAPI descriptions
  • Problem #1: Complex APIs will overload the MCP host's context
  • Problem #2: Larger API landscapes will overload the MCP host's context
  • Problem #3: Bad AX results in unsatisfactory AI results


Model Context Protocol (MCP) Erik Wilde: Your APIs Are Not Ready for AI (Yet): A Lifecycle-Based Readiness Guide
